definitions: To enter a place or building.
To arrive, especially at a particular place or time.
To become involved or relevant in a situation.
To finish a race or competition in a particular position.
examples: Please come in and sit down.
The train will come in at 3 PM.
That's where your expertise comes in.
Long skirts are coming in again.
The latest sales figures just came in.
She came in first in the marathon.
